Discussion Topic

Parents have the unique opportunity to learn more about their children through observing them play. Which of the following things can a parent learn through observing a child's play?

Sample Responses

• Activities that increase the child's intelligence (Correct)

• Events that trigger frustration (Correct)

• A child's likes and dislikes (Incorrect)

• A child's view of their world (Correct)

Sample Feedback

As parents observe and interact with their children through play, the parent-child bond grows stronger, providing a solid foundation for building lifelong positive relationships. Although the learning outcome may not be outwardly apparent, all types of play provide rich opportunities for learning and development. For children, play is learning, even when the observer may not be able to see what or how the child is learning.
